characters: TO GET A GLASS OF WATER AROUND
THE WAY I WANT TO FLY
DO I HAVE SLICE OPEN A CAMEL HUMP
LARGE SACK OVERFLOWING WITH GOLD WATCHES,RINGS AND OTHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We DISSOLVE from the photograph to Uberman standing in th exact same position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE PULL BACK showing him atop a BUILDING overlooking the below. A perfect view for our guardian hero.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He watches the thriving metropolis, bristling with life a people happily go about their day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yet, we can't help but detect a hint of sadness in Uberma expression.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look so peaceful from up here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His serenity is suddenly interrupted by a loud BEEPING SO coming from his wrist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks down at a BRACELET (a manly one) on his right ar It's a silver band with a FLASHING red letter "U".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like Roxanne's in trouble again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uberman leaps off the building and into the air. His cape gracefully flows in the breeze behind him as he shoots of into the distance like a speeding bullet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grime and moss decorate the outside of this long abandone building overlooking the COAST. Once a place of knowledge wonder - now home to a great evil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The inside is in complete contrast to the exterior. The h hall with a GIANT TELESCOPE teems with advanced ELECTRONI EQUIPMENT. Computers, monitors and machines which do not an obvious function FLASH and HUM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A STEEL DOOR slides open, revealing the subject of our st MASTER MIND - a villainous sight to behold. His FACE IS INEXPLICABLY LIGHT BLUE, topped by an OVERSIZED, MUSHROOM SHAPED HEAD with a CIRCULAR PATCH OF WHITE HAIR ON TOP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's dressed in the kind of costume only a super villain could pull off: a PURPLE JUMPSUIT AND BLACK BOOT ENSEMBLE WITH A GIANT GREEN "M" ON THE CHEST. His right hand, hang at his side, is a METAL GAUNTLET WITH THREE SHORT SPIKES PROTRUDING BETWEEN HIS KNUCKLES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Master Mind begins to survey the room with his TWO PERMANENTLY ARCHED EYEBROWS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A man dressed as ALBERT EINSTEIN is busy ranting to two o men. One, a hulking brute, is dressed as LEONARDO DA VINC The other, a small intellectual-type carrying a clip-boar is dressed as the philosopher PLATO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate the outfits. I mean, I get it: we're all supposed to be "masterminds" - very clever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EINSTEIN(cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just feel stupid. I mean, what the hell did Einstein really do anyway?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PLATO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theory of relativity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Einstein starts feverishly scratching his side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EINSTEIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you'd think he'd invent a wool sweater that didn't itch so much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Da Vinci and Plato's eyes suddenly grow with concern as t see Master Mind walk up behind Einstein.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Einstein notices his colleague's staring over his right shoulder and turns around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns around and Master Mind SEIZES HIM BY HIS THROAT his metal gauntlet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MASTER MIND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The real Einstein once said, "God does not play dice with the world." He was right, because the world is MY dice. Is that understood?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DA VINCI & PLATO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir! Yes, sir!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EINSTEIN (gasping for air)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Master Mind undoes his grip on Einstein's throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MASTER MIND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, then - clean slate. Do we have the girl?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DA VINCI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. She fell into our trap just like you knew she would.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MASTER MIND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reporters are a curious lot, and easily manipulated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He quickly checks his physique in a GIANT MIRROR, adjusts posture and sucks in his gut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MASTER MIND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, let's not keep the lady waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Da Vinci escorts a BLINDFOLDED and bound woman, ROXANNE RITCHI, to the back of the room where Plato and Einstein standing guard over a large BLACK SWIVEL-CHAIR facing awa from us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pulls free of Da Vinci's grasp and waits for him to u the blindfold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her face uncovered, we finally see Roxanne's striking features - all of which seem overshadowed by piercing eye that seem more put off by the situation than afraid of it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MASTER MIND (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Ritchi, we meet again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The chair turns menacingly slow, finally revealing Master Mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROXANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't need to turn around like that. I can recognize the stench of failure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Master Mind unleashes a wicked laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MASTER MIND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I trust you gentlemen know the very sassy Roxanne Ritchi, highly regarded investigative journalist who some say has a more than friendly relationship with our super powered foe Uberman. And Miss Ritchi, I trust you've already met my new crew: The Mad Geniuses!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roxanne gives Einstein a once over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROXANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like a real group of winners. At the risk of sounding cliche', you'll never get away with this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MASTER MIND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a way, I already have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roxanne unleashes an exhausted SIGH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROXANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We go through this every time. You kidnap me to get to Uberman, he immediately finds your hideout, escapes whatever lame trap you've come up with, and takes you and your cronies to jail. I propose we just save everybody some heartache this time by YOU letting me go, and ME forgetting this whole thing ever happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MASTER MIND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about my revenge?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROXANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can say it was wasting everyone's time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MASTER MIND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have a wicked tongue. I hope you rid yourself of that when you're my queen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roxanne unleashes a snort-filled laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROXANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. What makes you think I would want to be your queen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MASTER MIND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Power corrupts absolutely, Miss Ritchi. And when I have ultimate power over this city, I have absolutely every intention of corrupting you with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PLATO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Master Mind turns to Plato who's now standing at a comput terminal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MASTER MIND (annoyed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uberman flies toward the Observatory like a rocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uberman crashes through the wall to the room we were just He looks around, but there's suddenly NOT A SOUL IN SIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boat is shooting through the ocean, away from the observatory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Machines, cables and terminals criss-cross the craft's ma bridge. Through the enormous surrounding windows we can s the observatory shrinking in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Master Mind watches Uberman on a small TV monitor as the intently searches his hideout.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: UBERMAN (on monitor)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Master Mind!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uberman throws up his arms in frustration when suddenly -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MASTER MIND (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over here, old friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns to see a FAMILIAR BLUE FACE OF EVIL ON A GIANT SCREEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: UBERMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter, miss your old jail cell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uberman starts walking toward the monitor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MASTER MIND (ON MONITOR)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, I wanted to share the experience with my oldest friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MECHANIZED CAGE shoots out of the floor, suddenly trapp Metro City's protector.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Totally unfazed, our hero stares on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: UBERMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't possibly believe this will work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Master Mind pulls out a SMALL BLACK BOX with a SINGLE RED BUTTON on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MASTER MIND (ON MONITOR)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, can't I? I have attained control of the Earth's most abundant energy source. I doubt even you are strong enough to withstand the FULL CONCENTRATED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He presses the button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sinister-looking SATELLITE orbits Earth's atmosphere. I bay doors suddenly open, deploying two huge SOLAR PANELS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The panels shift, angling themselves in the direction of sun. They immediately start GLOWING as they absorb the burning star's power.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The front of the satellite begins to make a loud HUMMING SOUND as it prepares to unleash its unholy power.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the giant window we can see the boat is a good mile the observatory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PLATO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're now at minimum safe distance, master.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Master Mind turns from the CAMERA he was broadcasting on puts down the control box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MASTER MIND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excellent. Stop here, I like this view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PLATO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty seconds until impact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Master Mind turns to Roxanne who is being held by Da Vinc and Einstein. She almost appears a little bored.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Disappointed by her lack of horror, he walks over to the monitor now showing Uberman trapped in the cage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MASTER MIND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any last words?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uberman looks up at the screen with a cocky smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: UBERMAN (ON MONITOR)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes: there's no caging the power of justice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PLATO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten seconds to impact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the screen we see Uberman take two of the cage's bars his hands. He yanks...NOTHING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PLATO (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nine...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Master Mind stares at the monitor, slightly confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PLATO (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eight...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uberman yanks on the bars again, this time using his foot leverage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MASTER MIND (genuinely concerned)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: UBERMAN (straining)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold...on...a second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Master Mind looks back at Plato and Einstein. They're equ befuddled at the hero's sudden weakness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PLATO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seven...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uberman loses his grip and FALLS BACKWARD ON HIS ASS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: UBERMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Master Mind and the minions all cringe in unison.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Da Vinci turns to Roxanne not believing his ears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DA VINCI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did he just say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PLATO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Six......Five...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Master Mind begins to laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MASTER MIND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of trick is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uberman looks up at the camera with a very grave expressi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: UBERMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like you don't know. These bars are made of copper, aren't they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PLATO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MASTER MIND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, so?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uberman tries to shield his grief with his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: UBERMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You figured out my weakness, damn you. I CAN'T BEND COPPER!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PLATO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MASTER MIND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your weakness is copper?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PLATO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two...one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone turns to the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The satellite fires a giant BEAM OF LIGHT toward the eart

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The beam hits the observatory. The building instantly EXPLODES in a white nova blast of fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The blast is so bright everyone turns away from the windo Then, as suddenly as it began, the awesome light dies out

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One by one, the passengers unshield their eyes and look o toward the observatory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All we can see through the haze of destruction is fire an smoke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PLATO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think even he could have survived that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Einstein suddenly turns giddy with excitement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EINSTEIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa! Is it me or did you just finally destroy Uberman?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MASTER MIND (carefully skeptical)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...let's not get ahead of ourselves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Da Vinci suddenly sees something outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DA VINCI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, there's something in the sky, coming this way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROXANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uberman!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Master Mind turns toward the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An object is in the air, flying directly toward them. As closes in we can just make out the FAMILIAR OUTLINE OF A CAPPED FIGURE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MASTER MIND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone scatters and braces themselves for the impact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Master Mind, seeing all the good places taken, doesn't kn what to do with himself. He just covers his giant head wi his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The figure CRASHES THROUGH THE WINDOW and lands at his fe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks down to see a CHARRED BLACK HUMAN SKELETON. Arou its neck is the unmistakable black cape of Uberman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MASTER MIND (CONT'D) (horrified)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roxanne breaks out of Da Vinci's hold and runs over to th body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROXANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uberman?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stares down at the still smoking corpse, the tattered black cape with the yellow "U" on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roxanne turns to Master Mind, who's still visibly dumbfou at the grotesque sight before him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROXANNE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You killed him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roxanne's eyes roll back. Da Vinci catches her from behin she FAINTS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Einstein turns to Master Mind, looking at him as if he's walked on water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EINSTEIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now that he's committed the impossible - our villain is a complete loss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MASTER MIND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...so I did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EINSTEIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, I know you always wanted to. I mean, all the schemes all the plots - I never thought you'd actually be capable of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Giddy as a school girl, Einstein turns to his fellow henchmen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EINSTEIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is history. Every villain and lackey in the history of villains and lackeys dream of this moment, but when does it actually EVER happen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sudden realization comes over his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EINSTEIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good lord...You do all realize what we get to do now, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His question is met with acquisitive looks from Master Mi and the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EINSTEIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We get to go on a crime wave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRIME WAVE MONTAGE - SET TO "Fun Fun Fun" by The Beach Bo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's driving along when the men inside suddenly notice something - THEY'RE FLYING HIGH ABOVE THE CITY STREETS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We PULL BACK to see the truck being carried by a giant cl at the bottom of a BRAIN COPTER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside the cockpit Master Mind and his henchmen laugh maniacally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Da Vinci and Einstein run out the front of the bank holdi BAGS OF MONEY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two beat officers see them and take chase after them arou the corner and into an alley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a moment the police reemerge from the alley screami and running for their lives as a GIANT ROBOT CHASES after them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The robot stops, then suddenly it's head opens up like convertible car top with Master Mind and Plato at the driver's wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They smile and shake hands at a bad deed well done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's heading for downtown Metro as Master Mind and the lackeys coolly look on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three large DUMP TRUCKS pull up, filled to the brim with bricks of CASH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DRIVERS jump out as the lackeys take the driver seats the three trucks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Master Mind is about to climb into the passenger seat of when a drivers taps him on the shoulder and motions towar the tornado.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MASTER MIND (absentmindedly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Master Mind pulls a television REMOTE from his pocket and aims it at approaching windstorm of death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He presses the button marked "Tornado Off."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tornado shrinks and disappears just before it hits th city.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they drive through the city streets, Master stares out window with a hint of something in his eyes. Is it melancholy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Metro City's premier bowling alley. On top of the ne lit building is a GIANT 30 FOOT TALL CEMENT BOWLING BALL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HAL STEWART (early 30's) takes careful aim with his BOWLI BALL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a sport of honor, focus and grace. Honor the ball, focus on the pins, release the ball not hard and fast, but as if you were releasing a baby dove.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes a step, pulls back his arm, and releases the bal following it with his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a horrible shot - INSTANT GUTTER BALL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An aged barmaid type with a cigarette hanging from her mo looks over at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, do something like that - but center it more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She picks up her custom made FOGHAT BALL and takes aim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ATTRACTIVE BLOND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me how my form looks, honey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal focuses on the misshapen bumps of her enormous Johnso administration era derriere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, it's lookin' good. It's lookin' REAL good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't get anymore clear. This man is a pig.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VINNIE (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal, I want to see you in my office!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal turns to see VINNIE, owner of the bowling alley, call him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VINNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal sits down, facing Vinnie who's sitting at his desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VINNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're fired. Leave your shirt and locker key.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This bit of news hits Hal like a freight train.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fired? Are you going to tell me why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VINNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Showing up to work late. Showing up to work late drunk. Sexually harassing customers. Stealing from the register.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vinnie, I don't know where you're getting these accusations -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vinnie takes out a video tape from his desk drawer and pu in a VCR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HAL Oh, which one do you supposedly have here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VINNIE This is all of them at once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A WOMAN walks up to a BOWLING EMPLOYEE and hands him a pa of shoes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the employee turns to the wall of shoes, a very drunk disheveled Hal comes running in and pushes him aside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HAL I've got this one, Benny. So, Cinderella. Can I help you find your glass slipper?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WOMAN Yeah, I'm looking for a seven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He folds his arms on the counter and leans into her with cat-like grin on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HAL (with a leer) Seven - Well, maybe I could interest you in something in an EIGHT. Namely, me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Disgusted, she walks off screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HAL Lesbo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly realizing the register's open, he quickly grabs stack of cash and shoves it in his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vinnie turns off the television and waits for Hal to resp

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HAL From the angle of the camera, I can see where you might have gotten the wrong idea. Listen, Vinnie, I don't think you've thought this through. If you fire me, who's gonna be captain of the alley's bowling team?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VINNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um, I don't know. Maybe somebody who can actually bowl. You guys have never won a game. I hired you because you said you were on the pro circuit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I said I WILL BE on the pro circuit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VINNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, a loser like you will never amount to anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This harsh remark seems to leave Hal genuinely stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow...If that's how you feel...I guess we should then talk about what kind of severance I'm gonna get.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO BRUISERS open the door and throw Hal out onto the str

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He quickly picks himself up and turns back toward the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey...what about my ball?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bowling ball sails past him, just missing his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank-you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The massive building with a giant 7 on the roof stands in heart of Metro City.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cubicles and offices are alive with the hustle and bu of a busy news day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phones are RINGING, REPORTERS are TALKING, and Editors ar SHOUTING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevator doors open and out steps Roxanne Ritchi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything stops as the entire office suddenly falls SILE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somewhat taken aback by the reaction, Roxanne scans the r to see every eye on her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROXANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's...um...It's good to be back. Thanks for everyone's cards and concerns. I really appreciated it - now I'm ready to climb back on the horse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one is budging - their looks of pity are really starti to make her uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The back office door suddenly opens and out comes FRANK BONIN, the gruff, middle-aged Producer of Channel 7 News.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Noticing the silence, he looks up and sees the sad expressions on everybody's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone die or something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He suddenly notices Roxanne - both feet are placed firmly his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK (cursing himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROXANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank quickly walks up to Roxanne and takes her gently by arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on into my office, sweetie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sits her down on his leather couch, then quickly turns toward his door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we get this woman some water for God's sake? (to Rebecca)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gave you two months off. What're you doing back? People are gonna think I'm a slave driver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROXANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but I don't want people to think it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROXANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank, listen. I want to go back to work. I NEED to go back to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...You're hysterical, aren't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank sits down on the couch and blankets Roxanne with A EMBRACE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROXANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keeping you warm before you go into shock. (toward the open door)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SECRETARY quickly enters with a bottled water. She sets on the table in front of them and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roxanne pulls herself out of Frank's grasp and stands up face him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROXANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was a traumatic experience. Yes, everyone knows Uberman and me were...close. But what I really need - what would really make me better is getting back to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a sudden awkward silence from Frank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that's going to be...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROXANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you'd be happy to have me back.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Oh, we are. Honey, nothing makes us happier than to have our girl back, but...

dialogues.speaker: ROXANNE
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Things have sorta...changed.

dialogues.speaker: ROXANNE
dialogues.text: In three weeks?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Listen, I'm not one who likes to open up wounds - especially ones that are just starting to scab, but you were sorta our go to girl for the exclusive on Uberman. And now that he's gone...I moved Brad into your anchor spot.

dialogues.speaker: ROXANNE
dialogues.text: (disgusted) Brad? Brad Helms? The man is an idiot.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: It's the suits. They think it's time to switch things up.

dialogues.speaker: ROXANNE
dialogues.text: Oh, because they can't use me to get the big story.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: C'mon, Roxie. Using is in the nature of what we do. They used you, you used Uberman. Everybody's happy.

dialogues.speaker: ROXANNE
dialogues.text: (defensive) I didn't use him.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Oh, I didn't mean that. I know you two were in love or something. My bad.

dialogues.speaker: ROXANNE
dialogues.text: We were.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that's great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROXANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very in love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a hind of self-doubt in Roxanne's expression, as she's failed to convince even herself of this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROXANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. So, where are they going to move me if Brad has my spot?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Human interest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROXANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bake sales and pet stories.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told them I wouldn't be surprised if you just upped and quit. You busted your ass for that desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roxanne can hardly get it out - she's busy swallowing her pride

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROXANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank looks up at her, not believing what he's hearing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amongst the jungle of high rises, one small building stan out from the rest - A tiny, forgotten piece of 19th centu Gothic architecture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LIGHTENING FLASHES, revealing TWO CONCRETE GARGOYLES hold a cracked plaque, reading: METRO CITY LIBRARY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A mixture of old and new. Dusty Victorian furniture and dilapidated bookshelves sit side by side with pristinely futuristic machinery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The building has been converted into Master Mind's new SE LAIR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the center of the main room is a three storey tall GLO BLUE ORB. At the base of it is a sign that reads "Reactor Don't Touch."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We PAN OVER to the READING ROOM where Master Mind is sitt on a couch watching TELEVISION.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REPORTER ON TELEVISION (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's been nearly six weeks, and still no word on the whereabouts of billionaire playboy, and philanthropist, Wayne Scott. Tune in at 11:00 as we look into what has become Metro City's biggest mystery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TELEVISION NARRATOR (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We now return to "The Hero of our Hearts: The Uberman story."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Einstein and Plato come into the room holding a BAG OF LO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EINSTEIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just robbed the diamond exchange.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MASTER MIND (feigning pleasure)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great, great. Put it on the pile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Einstein tosses it on a LARGE PILE of purloined valuables the corner of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EINSTEIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything else today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MASTER MIND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Master Mind turns his attention back to the screen. Plato sees that Master Mind is in a funk and tries to snap him of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PLATO (cheerfully)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, the new reactor is installed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plato nods to the giant orb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PLATO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want to throw the switch? I know how you love to start reactors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MASTER MIND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Einstein gives Master Mind a funny look then exchanges glances with Plato before leaving the two of them alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without turning away from the TV, Master Mind addresses Plato.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MASTER MIND (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it, Plato?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PLATO (nervously)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, I can't help but notice that you've been...a little down lately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MASTER MIND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I want your opinion I'll beat it out of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PLATO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir, I know, but please forgive my impertinence. It's just that you seem to have lost your lust for our profession. You've stopped going on jobs and spend most of your time watching Uberman specials.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Master Mind relaxes slightly and turns to face the window a classically contemplative pose. After an overdramatic beat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MASTER MIND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have defeated my greatest enemy. I have free reign over Metro City. I have more wealth than a thousand Sultans. I've achieved all I have worked for...so why am I so unhappy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks over to a PAINTED PORTRAIT that looks almost exa like him, except slightly older, maybe meaner - MASTER MI FATHER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MASTER MIND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, my father, god rest his evil and tormented soul, raised me straight from the test tube to be a symbol of evil. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MASTER MIND(cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And, I have accomplished something he had only dreamed about - the destruction of Metro City's champion. I tell you, I've always lived with this unquenchable thirst. I thought it was to make him proud or to get absolute power. But now that I've pretty much accomplished both, I am at a loss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PLATO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I sort of have a theory about all that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MASTER MIND (snippy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PLATO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, for one thing, maybe Uberman was more important to you than you thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MASTER MIND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was a worthy rival. Sometimes I wonder, did he consider me his evil equal or was I just an annoying, little gnat to him? ...What's the second part?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PLATO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you sort of have a thing for Roxanne Ritchi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Master Mind quickly takes his lackey by the throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MASTER MIND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PLATO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, your plans always involve Ms. Ritchi either being kidnapped or placed in danger. If that's not love, I don't know what is. It's the grown up equivalent of dipping her pigtails in the ink well. Don't you see? She's the one treasure that's always escaped you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From Master Mind's expression, we see Plato's words begin to ring true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roxanne is having lunch with several girlfriends sitting around her, gabbing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRIEND #1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe you came back so soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRIEND #2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure it's not TOO SOON, honey?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROXANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just wanted to get back to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRIEND #3

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What we need to do is get you back on the saddle...the love saddle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Friend 1 and 2 give 3 disapproving looks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRIEND #3

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's been three weeks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRIEND #2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She just lost the love of her life, Grace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A WAITER comes by with a tray of CAESAR SALADS and begins setting them out for the ladies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROXANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I keep trying to tell people it wasn't really like that. Uberman and I - We were kinda having problems. We broke up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The waiter ALMOST DROPS HIS TRAY AT THIS. The women are t shocked by Roxanne's revelation to notice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRIEND #1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You broke up with Uberman!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRIEND #3

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must have REALLY, REALLY high standards. I mean, you were dating a god. I mean, what's it take?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROXANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe someone who's a little more aware of his faults. Someone a little more sensitive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRIEND #3

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. Someone who listens, sexy but attainable with cute little cheeks like a hamster and heartbreak in his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns to Friend one and two to explain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRIEND #3

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She wants John Cusack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRIEND #2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The actor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRIEND #3

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, the famous pediatrist - Yes, the actor. Ever since we were teenagers, Roxanne's totally had the hots for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROXANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, until he miraculously comes walking into my life, I'm just going to take a little reflection time for myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The waiter gets a confused look on his face then slips aw as Roxanne and her friends continue to chat away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The waiter tosses his apron in a trash can, then rolls up sleeve and presses A STRANGE LOOKING DEVICE STRAPPED TO H WRIST.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His image gets staticy, like a TV station going out, then disappears - revealing the man's true form underneath: MA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MASTER MIND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the hell is John Cusack?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A YOUNG MOTHER pushes her baby stroller past a building construction site.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A local POLITICIAN addresses a group of REPORTERS on the sidewalk, including Roxanne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POLITICIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Fifth Avenue Renovation Project, which I championed, will breath new life into the downtown area. New life means new jobs and new revenue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROXANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Councilman, is it true that your brother-in-law's construction company won the contract for this project?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POLITICIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...er...yes, but...look I'm not here to answer a lot of crazy questions...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The young mother stops halfway down the block, reaches in the stroller and tries to comfort her now crying baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Above her, a CRANE is maneuvering a pile of STEEL GIRDERS an upper floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal comes around the corner and heads in her direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crane GRINDS TO A HALT. The OPERATOR has a confused l on his face as he moves levers back and forth in an effor fix the problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal stops a few feet from the woman and stoops down to ti his shoe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The operator's hand slips off the lever, hitting a RED BUTTON. To his horror the crane DROPS ITS LOAD OF STEEL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The woman looks up to see the girders seconds from crushi her and her baby. She screams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal looks up and sees it as well. He starts to run out of way and crashes into the woman and stroller.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The reporters turns their cameras just in time to catch o film what appears to be Hal pushing the woman to safety j as the GIRDERS CRASH TO THE GROUND.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tears of joy in her eyes, the woman picks up her baby and kisses it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal struggles to catch his breath as the mother turns to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YOUNG MOTHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you! Thank you for saving me and my baby!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hugs him with her free arm, weeping with joy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HAL (not knowing what she's talking about)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a little uncomfortable with the woman's public displ of affection and the small child in-between their embrace

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HAL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There, there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal slowly eases out of the woman's grip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HAL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, we better...well, I hear these little guys smother easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The reporters rush over and surround Hal and the mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROXANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's it feel like to be a hero?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal looks up at Roxanne. Instantly, he's captivated by he beauty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...I'm just a man doing what men do. You're Roxanne Ritchi, aren't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're suddenly interrupted when another reporter pushes way in between them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REPORTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Were you scared?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HAL Scared? Who had time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The reporters eat this up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John Cusack stands in the rain looking up at a window of two story house. He holds up a BOOMBOX and "In Your Eyes" Peter Gabriel begins to play.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the couch, Master Mind and his minions watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MASTER MIND John Cusack, huh? So all I have to do is have a cute puppy dog stare, be willing to make a fool of myself and - Oh, REMOVE BOTH MY BALLS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns to see Da Vinci watching the movie and wiping a from his cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MASTER MIND Please, get a hold of yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roxanne is carrying a large paper coffee cup in her hands she peruses the isles. She sets it down on a shelf to pul book out and ends up KNOCKING THE DRINK OVER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROXANNE Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She goes to pick it up when someone bends down and picks up for her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking up to thank him, Roxanne is suddenly stunned speechless - It's popular and critically acclaimed actor CUSACK, or rather Master Mind disguised as him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "JOHN CUSACK" Oh the humanity - it was a Venti.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROXANNE (stunned) You're...you're.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "JOHN CUSACK" Yes, it's me. John Cusack...the actor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He notices the book she's reading.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "JOHN CUSACK"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, is that Shelly? Wait, I think remember something from that one - Let's see: "My head is screaming `I want you and need you' - my heart it keeps reaching to see you and feel you - yet in the end, I'm alone once again." Wow, I scare even myself. I'm sorry. I'm just really into poetry. Probably because I'm so sensitive and always going to great lengths to express myself. But enough about me. Can I fill you up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROXANNE (captivated)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Yes. (catching herself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "JOHN CUSACK"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I fill you up? Your coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROXANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roxanne talks as John Cusack listens to her every word intently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROXANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did have a boyfriend - until fairly recently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She suddenly begins to feel the stares around her as pass by being to notice who she's with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROXANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry - this is so surreal!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "JOHN CUSACK"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, they charge way too much at these places - Now back to your boyfriend. I'm interested and compassionate. I want to know about you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROXANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Things were complicated. He was a man married to his work. There was...there was a lot of competition in his line of business. I'm sure you know what that's like.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "JOHN CUSACK"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. In my business, one thing I have is RIVALS. For example, mine is...uh...Lou Ferr...igno.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROXANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...The body-builder who used to play The Hulk on TV?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "JOHN CUSACK"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did he? Well, we're always up for the same roles. Did your boyfriend have someone like that? A particular rival that was always getting his goat - so to speak?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROXANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...one rival in particular seemed to get more of his attention than I ever did. But enough about my problems.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "JOHN CUSACK"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly realizing his outburst, he begins COUGHING to ma it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "JOHN CUSACK" (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I got a whooping cough. Had it ever since Serendipity. I

dialogues.speaker: WONDER WHERE OUR REFILLS ARE
dialogues.text: (fakes cough) See, there it goes again. Please, go on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROXANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right, well, he seemed to need him more than he needed me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "JOHN CUSACK"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROXANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was conflict he thrived on. He always said he wouldn't know what to do with himself if Master - I mean, this guy were gone. It was like he needed it, like oxygen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The answer to his mental funk hits him like a bolt of lightening. He turns away from her as if for private time

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "JOHN CUSACK" (almost to himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I finally understand...The only logical answer is to recreate that rivalry - or if that's impossible, create one of equal structure. That's it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROXANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John Cusack snaps out of his dream-like haze realizing sh heard every word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "JOHN CUSACK"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, sorry, sorry. Just rehearsing for a part...where I play a man who talks to himself at inappropriate times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a sudden rush, he rises out of his chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "JOHN CUSACK"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to go right now, but I'd really like to see you again - if that's alright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roxanne looks up at him - She can't help but laugh at the craziness of the situation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROXANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd love that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Master storms in the office to find Plato and Einstein playing darts with the original Mona Lisa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EINSTEIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got her nose!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MASTER MIND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone stops what they're doing upon seeing that their master has returned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MASTER MIND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MASTER MIND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's plain and simple. Extraordinary minds need extraordinary stimulation. Without that stimulus they wither and die. Therefore, there is only one logical conclusion: I must create a new superhero.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EINSTEIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, maybe that's not such hot idea...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MASTER MIND (ignoring him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prepare for Operation Superhero Genesis!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lab is slick, white and ultra modern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dressed in a lab coat, Master Mind enters through a SLIDI GLASS DOOR rubbing his hands excitedly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MASTER MIND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prepare the subject.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He glances down into a large HOLE in the floor to see a n thirty year old man, SEVERS, shivering. Above the hole, a huge vat dangles precariously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Master Mind steps behind a glass partition next to Plato Einstein.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MASTER MIND (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plato, pour the toxic waste.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plato throws a switch causing the vat to tip hundreds of gallons of green and brown goo into the hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MASTER MIND (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drainage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The slime is sucked out through the floor, leaving a goo- soaked Severs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Master Mind looks into the pit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MASTER MIND (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Severs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SEVERS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel fine. Just a little sticky, but aside from that everything's completely -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOOM - Severs explodes. A hail of blood and tissue covers Master Mind and his men. For a good ten seconds nobody mo an inch. Finally...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MASTER MIND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through a glass WATER TANK we see a man breathing normall

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MASTER MIND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And this one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PLATO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We attached gills to him. He can breath under water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MASTER MIND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah. Does he have extraordinary strength?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PLATO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MASTER MIND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can he fly?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PLATO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MASTER MIND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Resilient to weapons fire?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PLATO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MASTER MIND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He just breathes under water, then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PLATO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah...yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Master Mind rolls his eyes and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The next guinea-pig, STENWICK, is standing in a sealed gl tube not much wider than himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MASTER MIND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plato, the radioactive spider, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plato throws the switch DROPPING A SINGLE SPIDER onto Stenwick's arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stenwick looks and winces as it bites him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STENWICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He brushes the spider off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MASTER MIND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything, Stenwick?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STENWICK (shaken)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Ah...sir, I didn't know this was about spiders. I have a pretty severe case of arachnophobia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Master Mind thinks for a moment, then turns to Plato.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MASTER MIND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're gonna need more venom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plato throws another switch, this time DUMPING THOUSANDS SPIDERS on poor Stenwick. His SCREAMS begin to fade as he engulfed with swarms of crawling arachnids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MASTER MIND (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How `bout now, Stenwick? ....Stenwick?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Master Mind is pacing back and forth. The muted TV plays the background.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MASTER MIND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This has proven to be a challenge. I just don't know what I want. What do I want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stares at Einstein, Da Vinci and Plato, but they offer advice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MASTER MIND (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want a man of moral fiber with a strong sense of right and wrong. Someone who doesn't seek power - instead, they must have it thrust upon them and find, within themselves, the courage to rise to the occasion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Einstein lets out a short laugh, getting everyone's attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EINSTEIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, it sounds like what you want is Uberman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Master Mind snaps the fingers of his non-metal hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MASTER MIND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it! Why make a copy when the real thing will do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lackeys look at each other, they can't believe what they're hearing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EINSTEIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was just kidding, sir. In case you forgot, you actually burned Uberman alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MASTER MIND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then we'll make a new one. Plato, bring me the box!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Master Mind and the lackeys stand in a circle around a sm table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plato places a STAINLESS STEEL CHEST in the tables center

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Master Mind opens it, he's immediately doused in WHITE GLOW emanating from inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MASTER MIND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behold - Uberessence. The very thing that gave Uberman his superhuman powers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EINSTEIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the hell did you get that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MASTER MIND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I shot him with a power sucking gun and had this idea to use this to clone a whole army of evil Ubermen. I'm not sure why I never got around to following up with that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PLATO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe he defeated you before you could, master.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MASTER MIND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Right. Man, he was good!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DA VINCI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want another volunteer, sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MASTER MIND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not another volunteer driven by the need for personal gain. Somebody else, somebody pure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Master Mind turns to see an INTERVIEW WITH HAL playing on muted television. Underneath his face is a blue caption w white lettering that reads: "Hal Stewart - Metro City's Newest Hero?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NEWS REPORTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...who risked his own life to save that of a young mother and her child.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, please, you're embarrassing me. I saw someone in need and I helped them. What more can we ask of ourselves. I ask you, what more?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A smile creeps across the evil one's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MASTER MIND (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody like him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plato is sitting in the van, staring into a pair of binoculars as he speaks on a cellphone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PLATO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, sir. This guy is a real piece of work. He used to teach bowling at Kingpin's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Master Mind is sitting with his feet up on a computer con as he speaks to Plato.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MASTER MIND (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A modest profession to brilliantly hide his true heroic nature. I love it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PLATO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you are absolutely going to love this -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We follow Plato's line of sight across the street where w see HAL PLAYING WITH A LARGE GROUP OF BLIND CHILDREN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PLATO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - He volunteers at a school for the blind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Intrigued, he suddenly sits up in his chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MASTER MIND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He volunteers. He doesn't ask for any reward for his deeds. The fates are shining down on me. This Mr. Stewart is truly an unselfish soul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From a distance, Hal seems to be consoling an upset child who's sitting on a rock. But up close...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You greedy little bastard. I already gave you a twenty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLIND KID

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you want me to play along? Then pay up, bitch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine, but you better be convincing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gives the kid a bill out of his wallet and looks over shoulder to see a HOT TEACHER walking toward them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here she comes, go to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like a miniature Brando, the blind kid buries his face in hands and begins to cry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLIND KID (weeping)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why can't I see! Why God?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal puts a warm consoling hand on the weeping boy's shoul

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Peter. C'mon champ, let me look at you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Hot Teacher stops and curiously watches from a distan

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boy looks up at Hal, tears running down his dark sunglasses - he should get an Oscar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, in life we're all given no more than we can bear. This happened to you maybe because you were meant to rise above it - Maybe to be an inspiration to the other little Peteys out there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLIND KID

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really think so, Hal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, does it LOOK like I'm lying? Now c'mon, go feel your way to class before you get your little butt suspended.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boy stands up and is about to take off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Petey, wait a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal uses his shirt sleeve to wipe the tears away from the boy's face before sending him on his way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Hot Teacher grabs her chest. Her heart is about to absolutely melt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't run into anything!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plato lowers his binoculars. From his perspective, Hal sh be next in line for popehood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PLATO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I've seen enough, sir. This is your guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MASTER MIND (O.S.) (over radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then return to base. We have much work to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plato starts up the van and pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a busy night. A couple of trucker types are shooting pool as the bartender slings drinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal is nursing a beer at the bar when he suddenly notices very ATTRACTIVE WOMAN sitting next to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he goes to straighten his stool-posture, Hal suddenly catches himself on the bar's TELEVISION - it's a story ab how he saved the woman and her baby at the construction s

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns back to the Attractive Woman next to him, then b to the TV. A plan of attack is forming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HAL (obviously playing it up for the woman's benefit)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, there it is again. This is really getting embarrassing now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The woman looks up at the screen and gives Hal a double-t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ATTRACTIVE   WOMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God! It's you!   You're the man who saved that woman   and her baby the other day! It is   you, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRUCKER #1, getting a drink at the bar next to them, OVERHEARS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal rolls his eyes and puts his hands up in the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HAL (to Attractive Woman)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, crap. You got me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRUCKER#1 taps Hal on the shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRUCKER#1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me tell you something. That was just about the bravest damn thing I've ever witnessed. (he turns to the rest of the bar) Hey, everybody! This guy's the hero from

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bar ERUPTS IN CHEERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal is riding on the shoulders of TRUCKER#2 and TRUCKER#3 `I'm Holding Out For A Hero' plays on the jukebox.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRUCKER#1 suddenly puts his hands in the air. The room quickly goes silent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRUCKER#1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to give you something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches into his pocket and takes out a medal. He hold up in the air for everyone to see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRUCKER#1 (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lost my whole platoon. They were a lot a good boys, a lot of good boys. That was just the way things were in "The Grenada." I'd rather a real hero have this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trucker#1 gives the medal to a speechless Hal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ATTRACTIVE WOMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you're on TV again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd looks up at the Television.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The anchor man, BRAD HELMS (early 40's, amazing mustache) suddenly has a memo passed to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRAD HELMS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This just in. Upon a second look at that tape from this morning, which we'll now replay for you, it appears it was not the heroic act it first seemed to be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tape shows Hal running in slow motion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRAD HELMS (O.S.) (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the tape slowed down you can actually see the man push the woman and her child out of the way in an effort to save his own life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tape shows Hal, in a clear act of self-preservation, pushing the woman and child out of the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In unison, everyone turns their heads back to Hal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess that looks kinda bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trucker#1 snatches his medal back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Master Mind, Da Vinci and Plato look down, spotting Hal cutting through a dark alley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DA VINCI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There he is, boss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Da Vinci hands Master Mind a fantastic looking silver rif

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MASTER MIND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, we're sure this won't kill him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PLATO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. He'll just feel a slight electrical shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MASTER MIND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Master Mind raises the rifle and aims it at Hal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal wipes the blood from his nose with his shirtsleeve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A LIGHTENING BOLT suddenly zaps Hal in the back. His teet spark and arc electrons as his entire body shakes and shudders violently. He finally collapses, knocking over a of garbage cans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An angry Master Mind slaps Plato.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MASTER MIND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slight electrical shock?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal lies flat on his back, his jacket smoldering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dazed, he slowly rises to his feet and looks up at the sk

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, I hate the weather in this city.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal walks off into the night as he attempts to slap the emitting smoke from his jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Master Mind turns to Da Vinci.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MASTER MIND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Follow him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a dirty, small studio. Laundry lies everywhere, dish are piled in the sink and the litter box looks like a minefield.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal comes staggering in. Through his POV we see the light wobble and streak like a hallucination.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shakes his head trying to clear thing up, but it looks worse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal makes his way to the kitchen table and plops down on chair. The room begins to swim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His CAT jumps on the table and sits down in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From Hal's POV the cat's face looks like we're seeing it through a kaleidoscope. Hal seems fascinated by it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't look so good, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't feel good. I was struck by freaking lightening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly Hal realizes his cat's talking to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HAL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AAAAAAHHHHH! You can talk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you're just hallucinating. By the way, we're out of orange juice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal jumps up, trips over a cardboard box and knocks himse out on the coffee table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal lies in the same position we left him last night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sits up and grabs his head. He looks like he has the w hangover in the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally, he remembers last night. He looks around, but no really sure what he's looking for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shaking his head, he walks to the kitchen and opens the refrigerator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls out an orange juice container and puts it to his mouth. It's empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
